alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 23 at 4:34AM PST until February 25 at 4:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Coastal Areas, Orange County Inland Areas, Riverside County Mountains, San Bernardino County Mountains, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire, San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An incoming storm system and associated atmospheric river will bring widespread rainfall to the area Friday and Saturday. Heaviest rain is expected overnight Friday into Saturday morning. Rain rates of 0.50 to 0.60 inches per hour expected. The highest rain rates will be on the southwest facing mountain slopes below the snow level. The snow level is expected to rise to 5500 feet Friday night, then fall to 3500 feet Saturday. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
